July 30, 1957
Dr. Maurice F. Seay, Director
Division of Education
W. K. Kellogg Foundation
250 Champion Street
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Maurice:
Many thanks for your consideration of the
three proposals we left with you some weeks ago. Thanks,
too, for your kindness in permitting revision to increase
the amount available for a seminar during the 1957-5B year.
We understand that this does not increase the total commitÂ¬
ment.
Memories still linger of the pleasant visit
in Battle Creek, especially the lovely home you have. The
pleasure was increased immensely by the presence of your
wife.
I trust you*ll have a vacation sometime this
summer. Hope to sneak off a few days in early August myself.
Sincerely,
FES:fmh
cc: Dr. Harry J. Skornia
Frank K. Schooley
